citeinfo.title: Soil dry bulk density as a function of burn severity for 2013, 2015, and 2017 in the area affected by the 2013 Black Forest Fire, Colorado USA

descript.purpose: This project investigated recovery of soil properties that influence flash flood generation in the area affected by the 2013 Black Forest Fire in Colorado, USA. Data were collected for three temporal snapshots (2013, 2105, and 2017) during a time period of four years following the wildfire to assess remaining flood hazards. Data include bulk density, loss on ignition, ground cover, soil particle size, soil-hydraulic properties, and simple infiltration modeling.

theme.themekey: wildfire, colorado, wildland fire, soil properties, soil-hydraulic properties

idinfo.accconst: None. Please see 'Distribution Info' for details.
idinfo.useconst: None. Users are advised to read the data set's metadata thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.

cntaddr.address: Box 25046, MS410, Denver Fed. Center, Bldg. 53

attracc.attraccr: Dry soil bulk density values are based upon manually split soil volumes and masses weighed on a calibrated digital balance. Values are reported to 2 significant figures. No additional tests were conducted to assess the accuracy of values.

dataqual.logic: Data match details provided and values fall within expected ranges. Data has been checked for duplication and omission.
dataqual.complete: The dataset only represents occurrences within the area impacted by the 2013 Black Forest Fire in Colorado, USA. Samples PSA 3-1 and PSA 3-2 have only 2 split values for 2013. The datasets are complete for 2015 and 2017, with the exception that site BF2 was not sampled in 2017 because the site was compromised by soil damage from salvage logging. Two files are included for 2013, one with 4 samples per site for the same samples used for loss on ignition and soil particle size measurement and one with 10 samples per site.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal locations are accurate to within recreational GPS accuracy (several meters).

vertacc.vertaccr: Vertical locations are accurate to within recreational GPS accuracy (5 meters)

procstep.procdesc: Dry bulk density values were estimated by splitting an oven dried (24 hrs at 105 degrees C) 6-cm soil core into known volumes and weighing those volumes on a digital balance.

enttyp.enttypd: Comma Separated Value (CSV) file containing data from 2013 for dry bulk density.

overview.eaover: Dry bulk density data for soil sampling from 2013, 2015, and 2017 in the area impacted by the 2013 Black Forest Fire in Colorado. Two files are included for 2013, one with 4 samples per site for the same samples used for loss on ignition and soil particle size measurement and one with 10 samples per site for the samples analyzed for soil-hydraulic properties. Note that site BF2 was not sampled in 2017 because the site was compromised by soil damage from salvage logging.
overview.eadetcit: Ebel., B.A., Moody, J.A., Martin, D.A. 2021. Soil-physical and soil-hydraulic properties as a function of burn severity for 2013, 2015, and 2017 in the area affected by the 2013 Black Forest Fire, Colorado USA U.S. Geological Survey Data Release. https://doi.org/10.5066/P9A88C67

distinfo.distliab: Unless otherwise stated, all data, metadata and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. Although these data and associated metadata have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness and approved for release by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the display or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.
